intro: Triunia, commonly known as the "Crown of Thorns," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Madagascar, and the Indian Ocean islands. The plants typically have succulent, fleshy leaves and produce showy, often fragrant flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. They are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions. Some species are also used in traditional medicine.
